greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let S(0) = {}, S(n) = {S(n-1), S(n-1), n}; sequence gives S(infinity).
comment: Sequence counts up to successive values of A001511; i.e. apply the morphism k -> 1,2,...,k to A001511. If all 1's are removed from the sequence, the resulting sequence b has b(n) = a(n)+1. A101925 is the positions of 1's in this sequence.
formula: a(2^m-1) = m. If n = 2^m-1 + k, with 0 < k < 2^m, then a(n) = a(k). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Aug 16 2006
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 14 2003
